p: Our understanding of how climate change affects health is still growing, but we know it will have multiple direct and indirect negative effects, including greater heat related morbidity, undernutrition, increasing water and foodborne illnesses, and mental health problems. 5 The largest driver for greenhouse gases globally is the combustion of fossil fuels, 6 7 and the resultant air pollution leads to an additional seven million deaths annually. 6 Although the health effects of climate change are wide reaching, they can still be mitigated if we take action now.
